answer:
Persons who received chickenpox vaccination have a much lower risk of getting shingles later in life than those who are not immunized. Chickenpox vaccines do contain a weakened version of the live varicella zoster virus, which can reactivate later in life and cause shingles, but this is very rare.
Immunization Nurse
question: Can you get shingles if you'v had the chicken pox vaccine?
